app.examples.todos.text3: example with support for adding, toggling, removing and filtering of the todo items.
app.examples.todos.text5: module and support for lazy loaded reducers (this is a lazy loaded feature module).
app.examples.todos.text6: Todos are persisted into local storage so you should see your todos also on later visits when using the same browser.
app.examples.stocks.title: Stock market
app.examples.stocks.description: Please provide some valid stock market symbol like:
app.examples.stocks.text1: Stock market example shows how to implement
app.examples.stocks.text4: Updating symbol query with different symbol will emit action which updates state with loading flag (reducer) and triggers effect for retrieving of selected stock.
app.examples.stocks.text5: Actions are debounced and every subsequent request will cancel previous one using
app.examples.stocks.text6: Success or error actions are emitted on request completion. Loading spinner is removed and stock info or error message is displayed.
app.examples.theming.parent.title: Theme scoping with nested components
app.examples.theming.parent.text1: Theme styles are not imported in component's
app.examples.theming.parent.text4: file. Because of this, theme styles are
app.examples.theming.parent.text9: selectors to prevent styles from leaking into child components. This can be achieved by using
app.examples.theming.parent.text10: in css rules to enhance their specificity. For example checkout theme file of this component:
app.examples.theming.child.title: child's h1
app.examples.theming.child.subtitle: should be without style
app.examples.auth.title: Authenticated component
app.examples.auth.description1: This component is only accessible for authenticated users
app.examples.auth.description2: Logging out will cause user to be redirected to home screen if visiting route accessible only to authenticated users
